definition: tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten

sentences.english: Propionic acid is product heavily short of in our country.
sentences.chinese: 丙酸是目前国内十分紧缺的一种产品。

sentences.english: Second, the Mid-Autumn festival is coming, especially in the market shortage of maotai liquor.
sentences.chinese: 其次，中秋即将来临，茅台酒在市场上尤为紧缺。

sentences.english: Shacheng Harbour Basin is rich in nature resources. It has not been largely developed now, because of short of electric power.
sentences.chinese: 沙埕港流域物产丰富，目前因电力紧缺多未开发。

sentences.english: College graduates are not in short supply.
sentences.chinese: 本科毕业生也不在是紧缺资源。

sentences.english: The east Haihe River plain area is one of the regions which are short of water resources in China.
sentences.chinese: 海河平原东部地区是中国水资源最紧缺的地区之一。

sentences.english: Of course, human resources shortages are not confined to mental health alone.
sentences.chinese: 当然，人力资源紧缺并仅不局限于心理卫生。

sentences.english: Meat was scarce during the war and too expensive for ordinary people.
sentences.chinese: 战争期间肉类紧缺，贵得普通人家买不起。

sentences.english: The building plans include much needed new office accommodation.
sentences.chinese: 建筑规划包括紧缺的新办公用房在内。

sentences.english: With the scarcity of world water resources, water crisis is becoming more serious.
sentences.chinese: 由于世界水资源的紧缺，水危机日益严重。

sentences.english: However because of fuel shortages, some aircraft are clogging up the tarmac.
sentences.chinese: 然而因为燃料紧缺，许多飞机阻塞了停机坪。

sentences.english: In recent years experienced customs broker in some areas is always more shortage.
sentences.chinese: 近几年有经验的报关员在一些地区始终是比较紧缺的。

sentences.english: Municipal wastewater recycling is one of the effective methods to resolve water resource problem.
sentences.chinese: 城市污水回用是缓解我国水资源紧缺的有效途径之一。

sentences.english: There is now less movement of money between banks and therefore a shortage of available money.
sentences.chinese: 银行间越来越少的货币进入造成了可提供的货币紧缺。

sentences.english: Some regions of the country are already feeling the pinch.
sentences.chinese: 中国的部分地区已经感觉到能源紧缺了。

sentences.english: Many of the boats are sunk, along with the soldiers and desperately needed supplies.
sentences.chinese: 许多船和士兵都成了鱼食，而供给也紧缺。

sentences.english: On every continent some rivers are drying out, threatening severe water shortages.1?
sentences.chinese: 每一块大陆上都有河流枯涸，水资源紧缺日益加剧。

definition: very short of (food, clean water etc)/extreme shortage/deficit
to be deficient in sth/to be short of sth (supplies, money etc)
to furnish/to provide/supply (as in supply and demand)
lit. many monks and not much gruel (idiom)/fig. not enough to go around/demand exceeds supply
property or cash held in reserve/stock
